message: Any idea why your SSL provider isn't in the Trusted Cert Authority on WP7?  Perhaps because they are a free authority?

StartCom is a perfectly fine authority, and is even supported in most IE browsers.

I think it's silly that people charge for SSL certs now anyway. Security and non-annoying encryption should be standard, baked into every website; not a premium to be paid for by commonly sensitive applications.

You should complain to Microsoft for failing their mobile platform.

@frantiic unfortunately, as you know, that won't accomplish anything.  Has anyone found a workaround for this?  The only option I have right now is to use some sort of middle layer that can make the request and then put out a response WP7 can deal with
It's BS but I think the solution here is to buy a cert. :/
